JBoss Forge

Productivity, Reliability, Testability

  • Lincoln Baxter, III
    • Software Engineer, Red Hat
  • Paul Bakker
  • Software Engineer, Luminis Technologies

@lincolnthree

  • Forge Project Lead

@pbakker

  • Forge Committer

Wat's this about?

Getting started sucks
Integrating stuff is hard
Remembering stuff is hard
Repetitive tasks are:
Annoying
Frustrating
Make you crazy
Ok, maybe we are already a little crazy

So what do we do about it?

No!

Our tasks for the day

  1. Get started
  2. Get integrated
  3. Get mental
  4. Get efficient
forge $   get-started   █
forge $   get-integrated   █
  • rest setup
  • rest endpoint-from-entity
  • arquillian setup --container JBOSS_AS_REMOTE_7.X
  • arquillian create-test com.example.foo
  • 
        @RunWith(Arquillian.class)
        public class ChildrenBeanTest {
        
        @Deployment
        public static WebArchive createDeployment() {
        return ShrinkWrap
        .create(WebArchive.class)
        .addClasses(RestApplication.class, ChildEndpoint.class,
        ChildrenBean.class, Child.class, ViewUtils.class)
        .addAsWebInfResource(EmptyAsset.INSTANCE, "beans.xml")
        .addAsResource("META-INF/persistence.xml",
        "META-INF/persistence.xml");
        }
        
        @Inject
        ChildEndpoint endpoint;
        
        @PersistenceContext
        EntityManager em;
        
        @Test
        public void testIsDeployed() {
        Child c = new Child();
        endpoint.create(c);
        Assert.assertEquals(c, endpoint.findById(c.getId()));
        }
        }
      
    • 
      
  • build --profile JBOSS_AS_REMOTE_7.X
    •
